properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Required) Whether the integration is enabled.

properties.name: integration_id
properties.description: (Required) The id of one of a signalfx_aws_external_integration or signalfx_aws_token_integration.

properties.name: external_id
properties.description: (Required) The external_id property from one of a signalfx_aws_external_integration or signalfx_aws_token_integration

properties.name: custom_cloudwatch_namespaces
properties.description: (Optional) List of custom AWS CloudWatch namespaces to monitor. Custom namespaces contain custom metrics that you define in AWS; SignalFx imports the metrics so you can monitor them.

properties.name: list description
default_action
properties.description: (Required) Controls the SignalFx default behavior for processing data from an AWS namespace. If you do specify a filter, use this property to control how SignalFx treats data that doesn't match the filter. The available actions are one of "Include" or "Exclude".

properties.name: filter_action
properties.description: (Required) Controls how SignalFx processes data from a custom AWS namespace. The available actions are one of "Include" or "Exclude".

properties.name: filter_source
properties.description: (Required) Expression that selects the data that SignalFx should sync for the custom namespace associated with this sync rule. The expression uses the syntax defined for the SignalFlow filter() function; it can be any valid SignalFlow filter expression.

properties.name: namespace
properties.description: (Required) An AWS custom namespace having custom AWS metrics that you want to sync with SignalFx. See the AWS documentation on publishing metrics for more information.

properties.name: list description
default_action
properties.description: (Required) Controls the SignalFx default behavior for processing data from an AWS namespace. If you do specify a filter, use this property to control how SignalFx treats data that doesn't match the filter. The available actions are one of "Include" or "Exclude".

properties.name: filter_action
properties.description: (Required) Controls how SignalFx processes data from a custom AWS namespace. The available actions are one of "Include" or "Exclude".

properties.name: filter_source
properties.description: (Required) Expression that selects the data that SignalFx should sync for the custom namespace associated with this sync rule. The expression uses the syntax defined for the SignalFlow filter() function; it can be any valid SignalFlow filter expression.

properties.name: namespace
properties.description: (Required) An AWS custom namespace having custom AWS metrics that you want to sync with SignalFx. See the AWS documentation on publishing metrics for more information.

properties.name: enable_aws_usage
properties.description: (Optional) Flag that controls how SignalFx imports usage metrics from AWS to use with AWS Cost Optimizer. If true, SignalFx imports the metrics.

properties.name: import_cloud_watch
properties.description: (Optional) Flag that controls how SignalFx imports Cloud Watch metrics. If true, SignalFx imports Cloud Watch metrics from AWS.

properties.name: key
properties.description: (Optional) If you specify auth_method = \"SecurityToken\" in your request to create an AWS integration object, use this property to specify the key.

properties.name: regions
properties.description: (Optional) List of AWS regions that SignalFx should monitor.

properties.name: role_arn
properties.description: (Optional) Role ARN that you add to an existing AWS integration object.

properties.name: services
properties.description: (Optional) List of AWS services that you want SignalFx to monitor. Each element is a string designating an AWS service. Conflicts with namespace_sync_rule.

properties.name: poll_rate
properties.description: (Optional) AWS poll rate (in seconds). One of 60 or 300.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the integration.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Required) Whether the integration is enabled.

properties.name: app_id
properties.description: (Required) Azure application ID for the SignalFx app. To learn how to get this ID, see the topic Connect to Microsoft Azure in the product documentation.

properties.name: environment
properties.description: (Optional) What type of Azure integration this is. The allowed values are \"azure_us_government\" and \"azure\". Defaults to \"azure\".

properties.name: poll_rate
properties.description: (Optional) AWS poll rate (in seconds). One of 60 or 300.

properties.name: secret_key
properties.description: (Required) Azure secret key that associates the SignalFx app in Azure with the Azure tenant ID. To learn how to get this ID, see the topic Connect to Microsoft Azure in the product documentation.

properties.name: services
properties.description: (Required) List of Microsoft Azure service names for the Azure services you want SignalFx to monitor.

properties.name: subscriptions
properties.description: (Required) List of Azure subscriptions that SignalFx should monitor.

properties.name: tenant_id
properties.description: (Required) Azure ID of the Azure tenant. To learn how to get this ID, see the topic Connect to Microsoft Azure in the product documentation.
The following arguments are supported in the resource block:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the dashboard.

properties.name: dashboard_group
properties.description: (Required) The ID of the dashboard group that contains the dashboard.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of the dashboard.

properties.name: charts_resolution
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the chart data display resolution for charts in this dashboard. Value can be one of "default", "low", "high", or "highest".

properties.name: time_range
properties.description: (Optional) The time range prior to now to visualize. SignalFx time syntax (e.g. "-5m", "-1h").

properties.name: start_time
properties.description: (Optional) Seconds since epoch. Used for visualization. You must specify time_span_type = "absolute" too.

properties.name: end_time
properties.description: (Optional) Seconds since epoch. Used for visualization. You must specify time_span_type = "absolute" too.

properties.name: list description
property
properties.description: (Required) A metric time series dimension or property name.

properties.name: negated
properties.description: (Optional) Whether this filter should be a not filter. false by default.

properties.name: values
properties.description: (Required) List of of strings (which will be treated as an OR filter on the property).

properties.name: apply_if_exist
properties.description: (Optional) If true, this filter will also match data that doesn't have this property at all.

properties.name: list description
property
properties.description: (Required) A metric time series dimension or property name.

properties.name: alias
properties.description: (Required) An alias for the dashboard variable. This text will appear as the label for the dropdown field on the dashboard.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Variable description.

properties.name: values
properties.description: (Optional) List of of strings (which will be treated as an OR filter on the property).

properties.name: value_required
properties.description: (Optional) Determines whether a value is required for this variable (and therefore whether it will be possible to view this dashboard without this filter applied). false by default.

properties.name: values_suggested
properties.description: (Optional) A list of strings of suggested values for this variable; these suggestions will receive priority when values are autosuggested for this variable.

properties.name: restricted_suggestions
properties.description: (Optional) If true, this variable may only be set to the values listed in values_suggested and only these values will appear in autosuggestion menus. false by default.

properties.name: replace_only
properties.description: (Optional) If true, this variable will only apply to charts that have a filter for the property.

properties.name: apply_if_exist
properties.description: (Optional) If true, this variable will also match data that doesn't have this property at all.

properties.name: list description
chart_id
properties.description: (Required) ID of the chart to display.

properties.name: width
properties.description: (Optional) How many columns (out of a total of 12) the chart should take up (between 1 and 12). 12 by default.

properties.name: height
properties.description: (Optional) How many rows the chart should take up (greater than or equal to 1). 1 by default.

properties.name: row
properties.description: (Optional) The row to show the chart in (zero-based); if height > 1, this value represents the topmost row of the chart (greater than or equal to 0).

properties.name: column
properties.description: (Optional) The column to show the chart in (zero-based); this value always represents the leftmost column of the chart (between 0 and 11).

properties.name: list description
chart_ids
properties.description: (Required) List of IDs of the charts to display.

properties.name: width
properties.description: (Optional) How many columns (out of a total of 12) every chart should take up (between 1 and 12). 12 by default.

properties.name: height
properties.description: (Optional) How many rows every chart should take up (greater than or equal to 1). 1 by default.

properties.name: list description
chart_ids
properties.description: (Required) List of IDs of the charts to display.

properties.name: column
properties.description: (Optional) Column number for the layout.

properties.name: width
properties.description: (Optional) How many columns (out of a total of 12) every chart should take up (between 1 and 12). 12 by default.

properties.name: height
properties.description: (Optional) How many rows every chart should take up (greater than or equal to 1). 1 by default.

properties.name: list description
line
properties.description: (Optional) Show a vertical line for the event. false by default.

properties.name: label
properties.description: (Optional) Text shown in the dropdown when selecting this overlay from the menu.

properties.name: color
properties.description: (Optional) Color to use : gray, blue, azure, navy, brown, orange, yellow, iris, magenta, pink, purple, violet, lilac, emerald, green, aquamarine.

properties.name: signal
properties.description: Search term used to choose the events shown in the overlay.

properties.name: type
properties.description: (Optional) Can be set to eventTimeSeries (the default) to refer to externally reported events, or detectorEvents to refer to events from detector triggers.

properties.name: source
properties.description:
(Optional) Each element specifies a filter to use against the signal specified in the signal.
  • property

properties.name: property
properties.description: The name of a dimension to filter against.

properties.name: values
properties.description: A list of values to be used with the property, they will be combined via OR.

properties.name: negated
properties.description: (Optional) If true, only data that does not match the specified value of the specified property appear in the event overlay. Defaults to false.

properties.name: dashboard-layout-information
properties.description: » Dashboard Layout Information
Every SignalFx dashboard is shown as a grid of 12 columns and potentially infinite number of rows. The dimension of the single column depends on the screen resolution.

When you define a dashboard resource, you need to specify which charts (by chart_id) should be displayed in the dashboard, along with layout information determining where on the dashboard the charts should be displayed. You have to assign to every chart a width in terms of number of columns to cover up (from 1 to 12) and a height in terms of number of rows (more or equal than 1). You can also assign a position in the dashboard grid where you like the graph to stay. In order to do that, you assign a row that represents the topmost row of the chart and a column that represent the leftmost column of the chart. If by mistake, you wrote a configuration where there are not enough columns to accommodate your charts in a specific row, they will be split in different rows. In case a row was specified with value higher than 1, if all the rows above are not filled by other charts, the chart will be placed the first empty row.
The are a bunch of use cases where this layout makes things too verbose and hard to work with loops. For those you can now use one of these two layouts: grids and columns.

WARNING These other layouts are not supported by the SignalFx API and are purely Terraform-side constructs. As such the provider cannot import them and cannot properly reconcile API-side changes. In other words, if someone changes the charts in the UI it will not be reconciled at the next apply. Also, you may only use one of chart, column, or grid when laying out dashboards. You can, however, use multiple instances of each (e.g. multiple grids) for fancy layout.

properties.name: grid-1
properties.description: » Grid

The dashboard is divided into equal-sized charts (defined by width and height). If a chart does not fit in the same row (because the total width > max allowed by the dashboard), this and the next ones will be place in the next row(s).

resource "signalfx_dashboard" "grid_example" {
    name = "Grid"
    dashboard_group = "${signalfx_dashboard_group.example.id}"
    time_range = "-15m"

    grid {
        chart_ids = ["${concat(signalfx_time_chart.rps.*.id,
                signalfx_time_chart.50ths.*.id,
                signalfx_time_chart.99ths.*.id,
                signalfx_time_chart.idle_workers.*.id,
                signalfx_time_chart.cpu_idle.*.id)}"]
        width = 3
        height = 1
    }
}

properties.name: column-3
properties.description: » Column
The dashboard is divided into equal-sized charts (defined by width and height). The charts are placed in the grid by column (column number is called column).

resource "signalfx_dashboard" "load" {
    name = "Load"
    dashboard_group = "${signalfx_dashboard_group.example.id}"

    column {
        chart_ids = ["${signalfx_single_value_chart.rps.*.id}"]
        width = 2
    }
    column {
        chart_ids = ["${signalfx_time_chart.cpu_capacity.*.id}"]
        column = 2
        width = 4
    }
}
The following arguments are supported in the resource block:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the dashboard group.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Required) Description of the dashboard group.

properties.name: teams
properties.description: (Optional) Team IDs to associate the dashboard group to.

properties.name: list description
dashboard_id
properties.description: (Required) The dashboard id to mirror

properties.name: name_override
properties.description: (Optional) The name that will override the original dashboards's name.

properties.name: description_override
properties.description: (Optional) The description that will override the original dashboards's description.

properties.name: filter_override
properties.description: (Optional) The description that will override the original dashboards's description.

properties.name: property
properties.description: (Required) The name of a dimension to filter against.

properties.name: values
properties.description: (Required) A list of values to be used with the property, they will be combined via OR.

properties.name: negated
properties.description: (Optional) If true, only data that does not match the specified value of the specified property appear in the event overlay. Defaults to false.

properties.name: filter_override
properties.description: (Optional) The description that will override the original dashboards's description.

properties.name: property
properties.description: (Required) A metric time series dimension or property name.

properties.name: values
properties.description: (Optional) (Optional) List of of strings (which will be treated as an OR filter on the property).

properties.name: values_suggested
properties.description: (Optional) A list of strings of suggested values for this variable; these suggestions will receive priority when values are autosuggested for this variable.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the detector.

properties.name: program_text
properties.description: (Required) Signalflow program text for the detector. More info at https://developers.signalfx.com/docs/signalflow-overview.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of the detector.

properties.name: max_delay
properties.description: (Optional) How long (in seconds) to wait for late datapoints. See https://signalfx-product-docs.readthedocs-hosted.com/en/latest/charts/chart-builder.html#delayed-datapoints for more info. Max value is 900 seconds (15 minutes).

properties.name: show_data_markers
properties.description: (Optional) When true, markers will be drawn for each datapoint within the visualization. false by default.

properties.name: show_event_lines
properties.description: (Optional) When true, the visualization will display a vertical line for each event trigger. false by default.

properties.name: disable_sampling
properties.description: (Optional) When false, the visualization may sample the output timeseries rather than displaying them all. false by default.

properties.name: time_range
properties.description: (Optional) Seconds to display in the visualization. This is a rolling range from the current time. Example: 3600 = -1h. Defaults to 3600.

properties.name: start_time
properties.description: (Optional) Seconds since epoch. Used for visualization. Conflicts with time_range.

properties.name: end_time
properties.description: (Optional) Seconds since epoch. Used for visualization. Conflicts with time_range.

properties.name: teams
properties.description: (Optional) Team IDs to associate the detector to.

properties.name: list description
detect_label
properties.description: (Required) A detect label which matches a detect label within program_text.

properties.name: severity
properties.description: (Required) The severity of the rule, must be one of: "Critical", "Major", "Minor", "Warning", "Info".

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: (Optional) When true, notifications and events will not be generated for the detect label. false by default.

properties.name: notifications
properties.description: (Optional) List of strings specifying where notifications will be sent when an incident occurs. See https://developers.signalfx.com/detectors_reference.html#operation/Create%20Single%20Detector for more info.

properties.name: parameterized_body
properties.description: (Optional) Custom notification message body when an alert is triggered. See https://docs.signalfx.com/en/latest/detect-alert/set-up-detectors.html#about-detectors#alert-settings for more info.

properties.name: parameterized_subject
properties.description: (Optional) Custom notification message subject when an alert is triggered. See https://docs.signalfx.com/en/latest/detect-alert/set-up-detectors.html#about-detectors#alert-settings for more info.

properties.name: runbook_url
properties.description: (Optional) URL of page to consult when an alert is triggered. This can be used with custom notification messages.

properties.name: tip
properties.description: (Optional) Plain text suggested first course of action, such as a command line to execute. This can be used with custom notification messages.
Notes
It is highly recommended that you use both max_delay in your detector configuration and an extrapolation policy in your program text to reduce false positives/negatives.
max_delay allows SignalFx to continue with computation if there is a lag in receiving data points.
extrapolation allows you to specify how to handle missing data. An extrapolation policy can be added to individual signals by updating the data block in your program_text.
See https://signalfx-product-docs.readthedocs-hosted.com/en/latest/charts/chart-builder.html#delayed-datapoints for more info.
The following arguments are supported in the resource block:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the text note.

properties.name: program_text
properties.description: (Required) Signalflow program text for the chart. More info at https://developers.signalfx.com/docs/signalflow-overview.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of the text note.

properties.name: time_range
properties.description: (Optional) From when to display data. SignalFx time syntax (e.g. "-5m", "-1h"). Conflicts with start_time and end_time.

properties.name: start_time
properties.description: (Optional) Seconds since epoch. Used for visualization. Conflicts with time_range.

properties.name: end_time
properties.description: (Optional) Seconds since epoch. Used for visualization. Conflicts with time_range.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the integration.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Required) Whether the integration is enabled.

properties.name: poll_rate
properties.description: (Required) GCP integration poll rate in milliseconds. Can be set to either 60000 or 300000 (1 minute or 5 minutes).

properties.name: services
properties.description: (Optional) GCP service metrics to import. Can be an empty list, or not included, to import 'All services'.

properties.name: project_service_keys
properties.description: (Required) GCP projects to add.
The following arguments are supported in the resource block:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the chart.

properties.name: program_text
properties.description: (Required) Signalflow program text for the chart. More info at https://developers.signalfx.com/docs/signalflow-overview.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of the chart.

properties.name: unit_prefix
properties.description: (Optional) Must be "Metric" or "Binary". "Metric" by default.

properties.name: minimum_resolution
properties.description: (Optional) The minimum resolution (in seconds) to use for computing the underlying program.

properties.name: max_delay
properties.description: (Optional) How long (in seconds) to wait for late datapoints.

properties.name: refresh_interval
properties.description: (Optional) How often (in seconds) to refresh the values of the heatmap.

properties.name: disable_sampling
properties.description: (Optional) If false, samples a subset of the output MTS, which improves UI performance. false by default.

properties.name: group_by
properties.description: (Optional) Properties to group by in the heatmap (in nesting order).

properties.name: sort_by
properties.description: (Optional) The property to use when sorting the elements. Must be prepended with + for ascending or - for descending (e.g. -foo).

properties.name: hide_timestamp
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to show the timestamp in the chart. false by default.

properties.name: list description
min_value
properties.description: (Optional) The minimum value within the coloring range.

properties.name: max_value
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum value within the coloring range.

properties.name: color
properties.description: (Required) The color range to use. The starting hex color value for data values in a heatmap chart. Specify the value as a 6-character hexadecimal value preceded by the '#' character, for example "#ea1849" (grass green).

properties.name: list description
gt
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates the lower threshold non-inclusive value for this range.

properties.name: gte
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates the lower threshold inclusive value for this range.

properties.name: lt
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates the upper threshold non-inculsive value for this range.

properties.name: lte
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates the upper threshold inclusive value for this range.

properties.name: color
properties.description: (Required) The color range to use. Must be either gray, blue, navy, orange, yellow, magenta, purple, violet, lilac, green, aquamarine.
The following arguments are supported in the resource block:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the chart.

properties.name: program_text
properties.description: (Required) Signalflow program text for the chart. More info at https://developers.signalfx.com/docs/signalflow-overview.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of the chart.

properties.name: unit_prefix
properties.description: (Optional) Must be "Metric" or "Binary". "Metric" by default.

properties.name: color_by
properties.description: (Optional) Must be one of "Scale", "Dimension" or "Metric". "Dimension" by default.

properties.name: max_delay
properties.description: (Optional) How long (in seconds) to wait for late datapoints.

properties.name: disable_sampling
properties.description: (Optional) If false, samples a subset of the output MTS, which improves UI performance. false by default.

properties.name: refresh_interval
properties.description: (Optional) How often (in seconds) to refresh the values of the list.

properties.name: list description
label
properties.description: (Required) Label used in the publish statement that displays the plot (metric time series data) you want to customize.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies an alternate value for the Plot Name column of the Data Table associated with the chart.

properties.name: color
properties.description: (Optional) Color to use : gray, blue, azure, navy, brown, orange, yellow, iris, magenta, pink, purple, violet, lilac, emerald, green, aquamarine.

properties.name: value_unit
properties.description: (Optional) A unit to attach to this plot. Units support automatic scaling (eg thousands of bytes will be displayed as kilobytes). Values values are Bit, Kilobit, Megabit, Gigabit, Terabit, Petabit, Exabit, Zettabit, Yottabit, Byte, Kibibyte, Mebibyte, Gigibyte, Tebibyte, Pebibyte, Exbibyte, Zebibyte, Yobibyte, Nanosecond, Microsecond, Millisecond, Second, Minute, Hour, Day, Week.

properties.name: value_prefix
properties.description: , value_suffix - (Optional) Arbitrary prefix/suffix to display with the value of this plot.

properties.name: legend_fields_to_hide
properties.description: (Optional) List of properties that should not be displayed in the chart legend (i.e. dimension names). All the properties are visible by default. Deprecated, please use legend_options_fields.

properties.name: list description
property
properties.description: The name of the property to display. Note the special values of plot_label (corresponding with the API's sf_metric) which shows the label of the time series publish() and metric (corresponding with the API's sf_originatingMetric) that shows the name of the metric for the time series being displayed.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: True or False depending on if you want the property to be shown or hidden.

properties.name: max_precision
properties.description: (Optional) Maximum number of digits to display when rounding values up or down.

properties.name: secondary_visualization
properties.description: (Optional) The type of secondary visualization. Can be None, Radial, Linear, or Sparkline. If unset, the SignalFx default is used (Sparkline).

properties.name: list description
gt
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates the lower threshold non-inclusive value for this range.

properties.name: gte
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates the lower threshold inclusive value for this range.

properties.name: lt
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates the upper threshold non-inculsive value for this range.

properties.name: lte
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates the upper threshold inclusive value for this range.

properties.name: color
properties.description: (Required) The color range to use. Must be either gray, blue, navy, orange, yellow, magenta, purple, violet, lilac, green, aquamarine.

properties.name: sort_by
properties.description: (Optional) The property to use when sorting the elements. Use value if you want to sort by value. Must be prepended with + for ascending or - for descending (e.g. -foo). Note there are some special values for some of the options provided in the UX: "value" for Value, "sf_originatingMetric" for Metric, and "sf_metric" for plot.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the integration.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Required) Whether the integration is enabled.

properties.name: api_key
properties.description: (Required) The API key

properties.name: api_url
properties.description: (Optional) Opsgenie API URL. Will default to https://api.opsgenie.com. You might also want https://api.eu.opsgenie.com.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the integration.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Required) Whether the integration is enabled.

properties.name: api_key
properties.description: (Required) PagerDuty API key.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the integration.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Required) Whether the integration is enabled.

properties.name: webhook_url
properties.description: (Required) Slack incoming webhook URL.
The following arguments are supported in the resource block:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the token.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of the token.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: (Optional) Flag that controls enabling the token. If set to true, the token is disabled, and you can't use it for authentication. Defaults to false.

properties.name: notifications
properties.description: (Optional) Where to send notifications about this token's limits. Please consult the Notification Format laid out in detectors.

properties.name: list description
host_limit
properties.description: (Optional) Max number of hosts that can use this token

properties.name: host_notification_threshold
properties.description: (Optional) Notification threshold for hosts

properties.name: container_limit
properties.description: (Optional) Max number of Docker containers that can use this token

properties.name: container_notification_threshold
properties.description: (Optional) Notification threshold for Docker containers

properties.name: custom_metrics_limit
properties.description: (Optional) Max number of custom metrics that can be sent with this token

properties.name: custom_metrics_notification_threshold
properties.description: (Optional) Notification threshold for custom metrics

properties.name: high_res_metrics_limit
properties.description: (Optional) Max number of hi-res metrics that can be sent with this toke

properties.name: high_res_metrics_notification_threshold
properties.description: (Optional) Notification threshold for hi-res metrics

properties.name: list description
dpm_notification_threshold
properties.description: (Optional) DPM level at which SignalFx sends the notification for this token. If you don't specify a notification, SignalFx sends the generic notification.

properties.name: dpm_limit
properties.description: (Required) The datapoints per minute (dpm) limit for this token. If you exceed this limit, SignalFx sends out an alert.
The following arguments are supported in the resource block:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the chart.

properties.name: program_text
properties.description: (Required) Signalflow program text for the chart. More info at https://developers.signalfx.com/docs/signalflow-overview.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of the chart.

properties.name: color_by
properties.description: (Optional) Must be "Dimension", "Scale" or "Metric". "Dimension" by default.

properties.name: list description
gt
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates the lower threshold non-inclusive value for this range.

properties.name: gte
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates the lower threshold inclusive value for this range.

properties.name: lt
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates the upper threshold non-inculsive value for this range.

properties.name: lte
properties.description: (Optional) Indicates the upper threshold inclusive value for this range.

properties.name: color
properties.description: (Required) The color range to use. Must be either gray, blue, navy, orange, yellow, magenta, purple, violet, lilac, green, aquamarine.

properties.name: list description
label
properties.description: (Required) Label used in the publish statement that displays the plot (metric time series data) you want to customize.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies an alternate value for the Plot Name column of the Data Table associated with the chart.

properties.name: color
properties.description: (Optional) Color to use : gray, blue, azure, navy, brown, orange, yellow, iris, magenta, pink, purple, violet, lilac, emerald, green, aquamarine.

properties.name: value_unit
properties.description: (Optional) A unit to attach to this plot. Units support automatic scaling (eg thousands of bytes will be displayed as kilobytes). Values values are Bit, Kilobit, Megabit, Gigabit, Terabit, Petabit, Exabit, Zettabit, Yottabit, Byte, Kibibyte, Mebibyte, Gigibyte, Tebibyte, Pebibyte, Exbibyte, Zebibyte, Yobibyte, Nanosecond, Microsecond, Millisecond, Second, Minute, Hour, Day, Week.

properties.name: value_prefix
properties.description: , value_suffix - (Optional) Arbitrary prefix/suffix to display with the value of this plot.

properties.name: unit_prefix
properties.description: (Optional) Must be "Metric" or "Binary". "Metric" by default.

properties.name: max_delay
properties.description: (Optional) How long (in seconds) to wait for late datapoints

properties.name: refresh_interval
properties.description: (Optional) How often (in seconds) to refresh the value.

properties.name: max_precision
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum precision to for value displayed.

properties.name: is_timestamp_hidden
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to hide the timestamp in the chart. false by default.

properties.name: secondary_visualization
properties.description: (Optional) The type of secondary visualization. Can be None, Radial, Linear, or Sparkline. If unset, the SignalFx default is used (None).

properties.name: show_spark_line
properties.description: (Optional) Whether to show a trend line below the current value. false by default.
The following arguments are supported in the resource block:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the team.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of the team.

properties.name: members
properties.description: (Optional) List of user IDs to include in the team.

properties.name: notifications_critical
properties.description: (Optional) Where to send notifications for critical alerts

properties.name: notifications_default
properties.description: (Optional) Where to send notifications for default alerts

properties.name: notifications_info
properties.description: (Optional) Where to send notifications for info alerts

properties.name: notifications_major
properties.description: (Optional) Where to send notifications for major alerts

properties.name: notifications_minor
properties.description: (Optional) Where to send notifications for minor alerts

properties.name: notifications_warning
properties.description: (Optional) Where to send notifications for warning alerts
The following arguments are supported in the resource block:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the text note.

properties.name: markdown
properties.description: (Required) Markdown text to display.

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of the text note.
The following arguments are supported in the resource block:

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the chart.

properties.name: program_text
properties.description: (Required) Signalflow program text for the chart. More info at https://developers.signalfx.com/docs/signalflow-overview.

properties.name: plot_type
properties.description: (Optional) The default plot display style for the visualization. Must be "LineChart", "AreaChart", "ColumnChart", or "Histogram". Default: "LineChart".

properties.name: description
properties.description: (Optional) Description of the chart.

properties.name: axes_precision
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies the digits SignalFx displays for values plotted on the chart. Defaults to 3.

properties.name: unit_prefix
properties.description: (Optional) Must be "Metric" or "Binary". "Metric" by default.

properties.name: color_by
properties.description: (Optional) Must be "Dimension" or "Metric". "Dimension" by default.

properties.name: minimum_resolution
properties.description: (Optional) The minimum resolution (in seconds) to use for computing the underlying program.

properties.name: max_delay
properties.description: (Optional) How long (in seconds) to wait for late datapoints.

properties.name: timezone
properties.description: (Optional) A string denotes the geographic region associated with the time zone.

properties.name: disable_sampling
properties.description: (Optional) If false, samples a subset of the output MTS, which improves UI performance. false by default

properties.name: time_range
properties.description: (Optional) How many seconds ago from which to display data. For example, the last hour would be 3600, etc. Conflicts with start_time and end_time.

properties.name: start_time
properties.description: (Optional) Seconds since epoch. Used for visualization. Conflicts with time_range.

properties.name: end_time
properties.description: (Optional) Seconds since epoch. Used for visualization. Conflicts with time_range.

properties.name: axes_include_zero
properties.description: (Optional) Force the chart to display zero on the y-axes, even if none of the data is near zero.

properties.name: list description
label
properties.description: (Optional) Label of the left axis.

properties.name: min_value
properties.description: (Optional) The minimum value for the left axis.

properties.name: max_value
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum value for the left axis.

properties.name: high_watermark
properties.description: (Optional) A line to draw as a high watermark.

properties.name: high_watermark_label
properties.description: (Optional) A label to attach to the high watermark line.

properties.name: low_watermark
properties.description: - (Optional) A line to draw as a low watermark.

properties.name: low_watermark_label
properties.description: (Optional) A label to attach to the low watermark line.

properties.name: list description
label
properties.description: (Optional) Label of the right axis.

properties.name: min_value
properties.description: (Optional) The minimum value for the right axis.

properties.name: max_value
properties.description: (Optional) The maximum value for the right axis.

properties.name: high_watermark
properties.description: (Optional) A line to draw as a high watermark.

properties.name: high_watermark_label
properties.description: (Optional) A label to attach to the high watermark line.

properties.name: low_watermark
properties.description: - (Optional) A line to draw as a low watermark.

properties.name: low_watermark_label
properties.description: (Optional) A label to attach to the low watermark line.

properties.name: list description
label
properties.description: (Required) Label used in the publish statement that displays the plot (metric time series data) you want to customize.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies an alternate value for the Plot Name column of the Data Table associated with the chart.

properties.name: color
properties.description: (Optional) Color to use : gray, blue, azure, navy, brown, orange, yellow, iris, magenta, pink, purple, violet, lilac, emerald, green, aquamarine.

properties.name: axis
properties.description: (Optional) Y-axis associated with values for this plot. Must be either right or left.

properties.name: plot_type
properties.description: (Optional) The visualization style to use. Must be "LineChart", "AreaChart", "ColumnChart", or "Histogram". Chart level plot_type by default.

properties.name: value_unit
properties.description: (Optional) A unit to attach to this plot. Units support automatic scaling (eg thousands of bytes will be displayed as kilobytes). Values values are Bit, Kilobit, Megabit, Gigabit, Terabit, Petabit, Exabit, Zettabit, Yottabit, Byte, Kibibyte, Mebibyte, Gigibyte, Tebibyte, Pebibyte, Exbibyte, Zebibyte, Yobibyte, Nanosecond, Microsecond, Millisecond, Second, Minute, Hour, Day, Week.

properties.name: value_prefix
properties.description: , value_suffix - (Optional) Arbitrary prefix/suffix to display with the value of this plot.

properties.name: list description
label
properties.description: (Required) Label used in the publish statement that displays the event query you want to customize.

properties.name: display_name
properties.description: (Optional) Specifies an alternate value for the Plot Name column of the Data Table associated with the chart.

properties.name: color
properties.description: (Optional) Color to use : gray, blue, azure, navy, brown, orange, yellow, iris, magenta, pink, purple, violet, lilac, emerald, green, aquamarine.

properties.name: list description
color_theme
properties.description: (Optional) Color to use : gray, blue, azure, navy, brown, orange, yellow, iris, magenta, pink, purple, violet, lilac, emerald, green, aquamarine, red, gold, greenyellow, chartreuse, jade

properties.name: legend_fields_to_hide
properties.description: (Optional) List of properties that should not be displayed in the chart legend (i.e. dimension names). All the properties are visible by default. Deprecated, please use legend_options_fields.

properties.name: list description
property
properties.description: The name of the property to display. Note the special values of plot_label (corresponding with the API's sf_metric) which shows the label of the time series publish() and metric (corresponding with the API's sf_originatingMetric) that shows the name of the metric for the time series being displayed.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: True or False depending on if you want the property to be shown or hidden.

properties.name: on_chart_legend_dimension
properties.description: (Optional) Dimensions to show in the on-chart legend. On-chart legend is off unless a dimension is specified. Allowed: "metric", "plot_label" and any dimension.

properties.name: show_event_lines
properties.description: (Optional) Whether vertical highlight lines should be drawn in the visualizations at times when events occurred. false by default.

properties.name: show_data_markers
properties.description: (Optional) Show markers (circles) for each datapoint used to draw line or area charts. false by default.

properties.name: stacked
properties.description: (Optional) Whether area and bar charts in the visualization should be stacked. false by default.

properties.name: timezone
properties.description: (Optional) Time zone that SignalFlow uses as the basis of calendar window transformation methods. For example, if you set "timezone": "Europe/Paris" and then use the transformation sum(cycle="week", cycle_start="Monday") in your chart's SignalFlow program, the calendar window starts on Monday, Paris time. See the full list of timezones for more. "UTC" by default.

properties.name: name
properties.description: (Required) Name of the integration.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: (Required) Whether the integration is enabled.

properties.name: post_url
properties.description: (Optional) Victor Ops REST API URL.
